criteria: Understanding of Jewish Messianic Prophecies and their Connection to Christianity
Knowledge of the Life and Teachings of Jesus of Nazareth
Understanding of St. Paul's Contribution to Christian Beliefs and Spread
descriptions: Demonstrates no understanding of Jewish Messianic prophecies.
Shows minimal awareness of Jewish Messianic prophecies; unable to connect them to Christianity.
Identifies Jewish Messianic prophecies with limited accuracy; struggles to explain their relevance to Christian origins.
Accurately identifies several Jewish Messianic prophecies and explains their general influence on the emergence of Christianity.
Clearly explains specific Jewish Messianic prophecies and analyzes their direct impact on the formation of Christian beliefs.
Provides a comprehensive explanation of Jewish Messianic prophecies, thoroughly analyzes their nuanced connections to the development of Christianity, and offers insightful interpretations.
Demonstrates no knowledge of the life and teachings of Jesus of Nazareth.
Shows minimal familiarity with Jesus of Nazareth; unable to recall any specific teachings.
Recalls basic details of Jesus's life and mentions a few teachings with limited accuracy.
Accurately describes key events in Jesus's life and explains several of his core teachings, as presented in the New Testament.
Provides a detailed account of Jesus's life, thoroughly explains his key teachings, and analyzes their significance within their historical context.

Presents a comprehensive understanding of Jesus's life and teachings, offers insightful interpretations of their meaning, and critically evaluates their impact on the development of Christian thought.
Demonstrates no understanding of St. Paul's role in defining and spreading Christian beliefs.
Shows minimal awareness of St. Paul; unable to identify any of his contributions.
Identifies St. Paul as an important figure in early Christianity but struggles to explain his specific contributions.
Accurately describes St. Paul's role in spreading Christianity and identifies several of his key contributions to Christian beliefs (e.g., Trinity, resurrection, salvation).
Explains St. Paul's missionary work and analyzes his specific contributions to the definition and spread of Christian beliefs, providing textual evidence from his letters.

Provides a comprehensive analysis of St. Paul's theological contributions, critically evaluates his influence on the development of Christian doctrine, and discusses the lasting impact of his missionary work on the spread of Christianity.
